sources.title: Objective, Burma! (1945) Errol Flynn · William Prince
sources.description: US paratroopers under Captain Nelson (Errol Flynn) are tasked with destroying a Japanese radar station during World War II.   Excellent acting and a fast-paced direction by Raoul Walsh.

metadata.Plot: A group of men parachute into Japanese-occupied Burma with a dangerous and important mission: to locate and blow up a radar station. They accomplish this well enough, but when they try to rendezvous at an old air-strip to be taken back to their base, they find Japanese waiting for them, and they must make a long, difficult walk back through enemy-occupied jungle.
metadata.Writer: Ranald MacDougall, Lester Cole, Alvah Bessie
metadata.Actors: Errol Flynn, James Brown, William Prince
